Petr Cech on power shift in north London: "No. There is always one odd year where things can change. The most important thing for us is competing against the other teams for the title."

Cech: "We are not competing against Tottenham Hotspur. Two years ago when we finished above them we were disappointed because we didn't win the title."

Cech on Spurs: "I think they have to win something to show the progression. Success is ultimately winning trophies. Although the season was not always what we wanted, we always had a trophy at the end of it."

Cech: "With the quality of Alexis and Mesut you are always happy to have players like this. But you need to feel they are committed, I have to say they come every day, they work and as a team we feel that."

Jens Lehmann: "Having William Gallas head the team in the 2007/08 season was problematic. We had learned of his appointment in the papers and we all shook our heads."

Lehmann on Birmingham 2008: "When Gaël Clichy was late for a ball while in his own area. His opponent fiddled the ball around him and then went down – time for a penalty and time for captain Gallas to spring into action."

Lehmann on Gallas: "Instead of standing at the edge of the area and clearing a possibly parried penalty like any other defender in the world, he abandoned the team, ran towards the halfway line and kicked an advertising hoarding."

Lehmann on Gallas at Birmingham: "After the match, he refused to leave the pitch but sat down in the centre circle like a sulky child, until the manager himself came to collect him."

Lehmann: "In the dressing room, Gallas came to blows with Gilberto, who accused him of seeking attention in a daft manner – the row dragged on for the rest of the season. Finally, it contributed to us finishing only third despite having been six points ahead in March."
